explicit

Class MDPSparse

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.ModelExplicit
      • explicit.MDPExplicit
        • explicit.MDPSparse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MDP, MDPGeneric<java.lang.Double>, Model, NondetModel

    public class MDPSparse
extends MDPExplicit
    Sparse matrix (non-mutable) explicit-state representation of an MDP. This is much faster to access than e.g. MDPSimple and should also be more compact. The catch is that you have to create the model all in one go and then can't modify it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface explicit.MDP

        MDP.TransitionConsumer, MDP.TransitionToDoubleFunction

      protected java.lang.Object[] actions
      Array of action labels for choices; if null, there are no actions; otherwise, is an array of size numDistrs

      protected int[] cols
      Column (destination) indices for each transition (array of size numTransitions)
      protected int maxNumDistrs

      Probabilities for each transition (array of size numTransitions)
      protected int numDistrs 
      protected int numTransitions 
      protected int[] rowStarts
      Indices into choiceStarts giving the start of the choices for each state; array is of size numStates+1 and last entry is always equal to numDistrs

      • MDPSparse

      • MDPSparse

        public MDPSparse(MDPSimple mdp,
                 boolean sort)
        Copy constructor (from MDPSimple). Optionally, transitions within choices are sorted (by ascending order of column index).
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP to copy
        sort - Whether or not to sort column indices

      • MDPSparse

        public MDPSparse(MDPSimple mdp,
                 boolean sort,
                 int[] permut)
        Copy constructor (from MDPSimple). Optionally, transitions within choices are sorted (by ascending order of column index). Also, optionally, a state index permutation can be provided, i.e. old state index i becomes index permut[i]. Note: a states list, if present, will not be permuted and should be set separately afterwards if required.
        Parameters:
        mdp - The MDP to copy
        sort - Whether or not to sort column indices
        permut - State space permutation

      • MDPSparse

        public MDPSparse(MDP mdp,
                 java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> states,
                 java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> actions)
        Copy constructor for a (sub-)MDP from a given MDP. The states and actions will be indexed as given by the order of the lists states and actions.
        Parameters:
        mdp - MDP to copy from
        states - States to copy
        actions - Actions to copy

      • buildFromPrismExplicit

        public void buildFromPrismExplicit(java.lang.String filename)
                            throws PrismException
        Description copied from class: ModelExplicit
        Build (anew) from a list of transitions exported explicitly by PRISM (i.e. a .tra file). Note that initial states are not configured (since this info is not in the file), so this needs to be done separately (using ModelExplicit.addInitialState(int).
        Specified by:
        buildFromPrismExplicit in class ModelExplicit
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • findDeadlocks

        public void findDeadlocks(boolean fix)
                   throws PrismException
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Find all deadlock states and store this information in the model. If requested (if fix=true) and if needed (i.e. for DTMCs/CTMCs), fix deadlocks by adding self-loops in these states. The set of deadlocks (before any possible fixing) can be obtained from Model.getDeadlockStates().
        Throws:
        PrismException - if the model is unable to fix deadlocks because it is non-mutable.

      • checkForDeadlocks

        public void checkForDeadlocks(java.util.BitSet except)
                       throws PrismException
        Description copied from interface: Model
        Checks for deadlocks and throws an exception if any exist. States in 'except' (If non-null) are excluded from the check.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

      • prob0step

        public void prob0step(java.util.BitSet subset,
                      java.util.BitSet u,
                      boolean forall,
                      java.util.BitSet result)
        Description copied from interface: MDPGeneric
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob0, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for all/some choices, there is a transition to a state in u. Quantification over choices is determined by forall.
        Parameters:
        subset - Only compute for these states
        u - Set of states u
        forall - For-all or there-exists (true=for-all, false=there-exists)
        result - Store results here

      • prob1Astep

        public void prob1Astep(java.util.BitSet subset,
                       java.util.BitSet u,
                       java.util.BitSet v,
                       java.util.BitSet result)
        Description copied from interface: MDPGeneric
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1A, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for all choices, there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u.
        Parameters:
        subset - Only compute for these states
        u - Set of states u
        v - Set of states v
        result - Store results here

      • prob1Estep

        public void prob1Estep(java.util.BitSet subset,
                       java.util.BitSet u,
                       java.util.BitSet v,
                       java.util.BitSet result,
                       int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDPGeneric
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1E, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for some choice, there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info for 1 states.
        Parameters:
        subset - Only compute for these states
        u - Set of states u
        v - Set of states v
        result - Store results here
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff, for all/some choices, there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u. Quantification over choices is determined by forall.

                               int i,
                               java.util.BitSet u,
                               java.util.BitSet v)
        Description copied from interface: MDPGeneric

        public double mvMultMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                 double[] vect,
                                 boolean min,
                                 int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max, i.e. return min/max_k { sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j] } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultJacMinMaxSingle

        public double mvMultJacMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                    double[] vect,
                                    boolean min,
                                    int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_k { (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultJacSingle

        public double mvMultJacSingle(int s,
                              int i,
                              double[] vect)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication for a specific choice. i.e. return min/max_k { (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) }
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        i - Choice index
        vect - Vector to multiply by

      • mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle

        public double mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                              double[] vect,
                                              MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                              double discount,
                                              boolean min,
                                              int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + discount*(sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        discount - The discount factor (in (0,1])
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

                                    int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j] } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.

        Parameters:

      • mvMultRewJacMinMaxSingle

        public double mvMultRewJacMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                       double[] vect,
                                       MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                       boolean min,
                                       int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        s - State (row) index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultRight

        public void mvMultRight(int[] states,
                        int[] strat,
                        double[] source,
                        double[] dest)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Multiply the probability matrix induced by the MDP and strat to the right of source. Only those entries in source and only those columns in the probability matrix are considered, that are elements of states. The result of this multiplication is added to the contents of dest.
        Parameters:
        states - States for which to multiply
        strat - (Memoryless) strategy to use
        source - Vector to multiply matrix with
        dest - Vector to write result to.

      • toString
